title: Pteropus
summary:
Pteropus (suborder Yinpterochiroptera) is a genus of megabats which are among the largest bats in the world. They are commonly known as fruit bats or flying foxes, among other colloquial names. 
They live in the South Asia, Southeast Asia, Australia,  East Africa, and some oceanic islands in the Indian and Pacific Oceans.[3] 
There are at least 60 extant species in the genus.[4]
